review: I bought the Amazon Fire TV Stick and was very impressed with it. Setup is fast, it is very responsive and easy-to-use. However, in the end, I have decided to return it to Amazon. Why? For me, the ecosystem is too limited. Channels (or apps) that are free on other systems are either not available or have been developed by a 3rd party and need to be purchased. For $7 more, I have switched to the Roku Streaming Stick, which has a much larger selection of apps, many of them free. I believe I would spend more than $7 dollars to get the content I want if I stuck with the Fire TV Stick so I am willing to pay a little more up front.I think Amazon makes great products (Kindles, Fire TV stick, etc.), but the walled garden they lock you into just does not work for me. If you use Amazon mainly for your ecosystem content, their products represent a fantastic value. But for someone like myself, who prefers to use Google services, Amazon becomes, frustratingly, a compromise I am not willing to accept.
